Comment: Used to display mod types in mod tooltips
Used to display a mod category and slot type of mods in tooltips
Used to show that a mod is not compatible with the current selected item
Not specifically relgious - refers to an explosive AOE damage on death

SourceString: Targets killed will damage others around them.

Rods carrying an activated veltecite core; initially trialed just to see what would happen, the kinetic compression of the veltecite against expiring organic matter triggers an energy release damaging nearby still-living organisms.
An ammo container made with non-standard materials, makes for an easier weapon reload.
A container with improved internals, allows for an increased rod count. Of course, it also increases the container's weight.
Shaped rods with hardened tips. They'll fly through most creatures without them even realizing they were hit.
Rods modified to carry a mix toxic to most of the fauna of Fortuna III. The added complexity to the rod reduces damage to other targets, though it's unlikely they'll be celebrating that when hit.
Moving some springs from the stabilizer to the chambering mechanism makes for a more comfortable bolting, provided you have a strong shoulder.
Don't worry, nothing too important is missing.
A really fast spinny thing that helps keep your rifle centered.
Adds a 4x scope, but increases ADS slightly.
Quicker ADS at the cost of a smaller scope.
Adds a longer range scope to an already long range gun, cheeky!
The magnification levels on this new scope is getting out of hand...
Your joints will thank you when you're older.
You'll appreciate it after carrying this thing for a few miles.
Improves stability just enough to matter.
Sometimes things line up just right...
For when you're really not trying to be subtle.
Rounds carrying toxins particularly harmful to the creatures of Fortuna III. Doesn't do much to humans, but a bullet's still a bullet.
Sometimes you really need an extra handful of rounds.

SourceString: Just imagine the kind of person that puts barbs on a bullet.

Con: They can't see your sweet gun

Gain one additional charge of suit energy. Also reduces slide speed.
Longer slide, one less charge of suit energy.
Increased amount of suit energy charges, but each time you take damage one is temporarily lost
Enables you to trigger the Jetpack Slam attack at a steeper angle.
Weaker jetpack thrusters, however you can stay in the air for longer due to reduced fuel consumption.
Extremely strong jetpack thrusters, but thirsty like a whale for jetfuel.
While aiming in the air you descend very slowly.
Wider and stronger charge punch damage, weaker super-jump.
Stronger super-jump, decreased charge punch damage.
Faster charge punch, only deals damage on direct hits, slightly faster movement speed and weaker jump.
Less effected by damage interruption when interacting, slower ability cooldowns.
Shorter HP regen delay, increased HP regen speed, slower ability cooldowns.
When on Low HP you become faster, stronger and better at reloading. Also ability cooldowns are slower... Not super catchy, but it's true.
Does what it says on the label.
Shields increased by 100, maximum movement speed is lowered.
Damage increase and cooldown reduction when performing kills.
Gain HP when performing kills. Health regeneration cooldown is increased.
Gain more XP, but have reduced health.
Increased defense while in the air, also deal less damage at the same time.
Ability cooldowns are slightly faster, maximum movement speed is slightly reduced.
Deal more and receive more damage while in the air.
